result.execSummary:
The defendant Joel J. Helding was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Felon Possess Firearm [Modifiers: Repeater], a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.29(2)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Clerk: Charli    
Case Called: 3:42 p.m.
INCLUDES: 14CF11, 14CF357, 10CF410
State appears by ADA Ralph Uttke.  Def appears in person, in custody, with Atty Julianne Lennon.  

***TIME AND DATE SET FOR PLEA/SENTENCING on 14CF11, 14CF357***
Plea Quest/Waiver of Rights filed.  

State moves to:
14CF11
CT 2. (Felon Possesses Drug Paraphernalia- Repeater)>>DRI
CT 3. (Felon Possesses Drug Paraphernalia- Repeater)>>DRI
14CF357
CT 1. (Battery by Prisoners-Repeater-PTAC)>>DRI
COURT grants above.

PLEA: 
14CF11
CT 1. (Felon Possesses Firearm- Repeater)>> No Contest
14CF357
CT 2. (Disorderly Conduct- Repeater)>> No Contest

COURT advises def of rights (including constitutional rights) & penalties & ques def to understanding.  
COURT finds plea & waiver of rights freely & vol made, a factual basis, & def guilty. 

COURT ORDERS: 
14CF11- 9 years Prison (4 years IC & 5 years ES) to run concurrent to 10CF410 CONDITIONS: CC; DNA Sample & Surcharge.

14CF357- 9 mos MCJ to run concurrent; CONDITIONS: CC. 


***TIME AND DATE SET FOR SENTENCING AFTER REVOCATION on 10CF410.***

COURT ORDERS: 10 years Prison (5 years IC & 5 years ES) to run concurrent 14CF11; CONDITIONS: Absolute Sobriety from Alcohol and drugs; Treatment/Assessment/Counseling as deemed appropriate by agent; CC.

COURT notes def has 819 days credit in 14CF11; 877 days credit in 10CF410; 9 mos credit for 14CF357.
COURT notes def is eligable for CIP & SAP.

Case called: 9:03
State appears by ADA Elisabeth Gramer, Defendant appears in person in custody with Atty Julianne Lennon.
Time set arraignment and request for competency exam.
Court finds that an arraignment has been done in this matter and Atty Lennon's request to substitute on this case is not timely.
State has filed the Information previously in this matter.
Atty Lennon is still requesting a competency exam.
Court allows this file to be consolidated with the Br 2 case (14CF357)
Court recuses herself from this matter as there will be a number of his older cases that need to be looked at also.

Clerk Shirley
Case called: 8:42
State appars by ADA Kyle Mayo for Elisabeth Gramer, Defendant appears in custody with Atty Julianne Lennon.
Time set for Atty Lennon's motion to review JV records.
Atty Lennon states that it is her understanding that some records have been destroyed but she is specifically looking for a psychological examination done when the defendant was a juvenile. State has no objection.
Atty Lennon hands the court an order with the list of case numbers she wishes to review.  Court explains that some of these records are old and she may have a conflict. Defendant and Atty Lennon waive any conflict.
Court grants the request and signs the orders. CONSENT TO BE SEALED. Atty Lennon to turn any findings over to the state if she wishes to use it in her client's defense.
